titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jean Louis Berlandier Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Sunday December 9, 2018 at 04:52
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Jean Louis Berlandier papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers consist of diaries and accounts written or collected by Jean Louis Berlandier, including works by Rafael Chovell, Manuel de Mier y Teran, José Francisco Ruiz, Stephen F. Austin, Juan Pedro Walker and others. The papers include maps, letters, diaries, histories, and government documents containing geographical, ethnographic, and historical information about the Mexican Republic, particularly the region between the Sabine River and Sierra Madre, with extensive coverage of the areas that today comprise Tamaulipas, Nuevo Leon, Cohuila, and Texas.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Henry R. Wagner, 1919; H. P. Kraus, Inc., 1986; and gift of William Reese (Yale 1977), 1993.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The bulk of the material in the papers was originally part of a larger collection purchased in 1853 by Darius Nash Couch in Matamoros, Mexico, later acquired by the English firm of Bernard Quaritch and the collector Sir Thomas Phillipps. Karl Hiersemann of Leipzig purchased most of the Berlandier papers at the Phillipps auctions in 1913 and 1919, Henry R. Wagner purchased them from him, and the library purchased the papers from Wagner in 1919.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Jean Louis Berlandier Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jean Louis Berlandier Papers. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
In 2015 this collection received a basic level of reorganization and some augmented description, including consolidation of former call numbers into a single call number: WA MSS S-300.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from legacy descriptive information created by Sir Thomas Phillipps, Henry R. Wagner, Thomas W. Streeter, and the Library. Some titles have been supplied by staff during processing. Catalog numbers created by Phillipps have been noted for the items, where possible. The Phillipps numbers were published in Phillipps' catalog of his collection and in auction catalogs; they are also present on the items for which they are noted.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: WA MSS S-300-325, WA MSS S-328, Uncat WA MS 56, Uncat WA MS 178, and Uncat WA MS File Berlandier.

bioghist.head: Jean Louis Berlandier
bioghist.p: Jean Louis Berlandier (circa 1805-1851), French botanist, trained under Cuvier in Paris and Auguste Pyrame de Candolle in Geneva, who sent him to Mexico in 1826 to collect botanical specimens. In 1827, he joined the Mexican Comisión de Limites, an international boundary commission between the United States and Mexico. Berlandier conducted botanical, environmental, and social surveys of the border region for the Comisión. He later settled in Matamoros, where he worked as a doctor. During 1845-1846 he worked as a hospital administrator and, after the American invasion during the Mexican War, 1846-1858, acted as interpreter for the United States Army.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of diaries and accounts written or collected by Jean Louis Berlandier during his travels in Texas and Mexico. The papers include maps, letters, diaries, histories, and government documents containing geographical, ethnographic, and historical information about the Mexican Republic, particularly the region between the Sabine River and Sierra Madre, with extensive coverage of the areas that today comprise Tamaulipas, Nuevo Leon, Coahuila, and Texas. Included in the collection are Juan Pedro Walker's diary of expeditions in 1815-1816 from Monterey into Texas, Jean Louis Berlandier's writings on Mexico, and letters from Manuel Gayasos de Lemos to William Dunbar concerning the Florida border. Other writers include Rafael Chovell, José Francisco Ruiz, and Manuel de Mier y Teran.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Henry R. Wagner Berlandier Papers, 1745-1860. II. Materials Purchased from H. P. Kraus, Inc., 1826-1844. III. Material Donated by William S. Reese, circa 1850. IV. Miscellaneous Berlandier Manuscripts, 1827-1849. Series correspond to acquisitions.

Researchers should note that material within each acquisition may overlap with or relate to material found in other acquisitions. For instance, diaries from Berlandier's expeditions may be found in multiple acquisitions. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received and cataloged by the library.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Articles describing the collection and its history can be found in The Yale University Library Gazette 31(1957):130-32, 32(1958):71-76.

did.unittitle: Henry R. Wagner Berlandier Papers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is arranged in the order in which it was originally cataloged by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection contains diaries, ledgers, maps, and drawings primarily created or collected by Jean Louis Berlandier and the Mexican Comision de Limites in Texas and Mexico from 1826-1860. This material provides geographical, ethnographic, historical, and visual documentation of the Mexican Republic and the Mexican-American War. The series also includes a twenty volume set titled "Gazetteer of Mexico," with entries for Mexican and Texan pueblos and cities.

did.unittitle: Berlandier, Gazetteer of Mexico

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Twenty autograph manuscript volumes of a geographical index of Mexico. Includes information on the location of pueblos and cities, as well as information on their government, inhabitants, languages spoken, and climate. Areas surveyed include Cuernevaca, San Miguel, Veracruz, Oaxaca, Coahuila, and Nuevo Leon. There is also an extensive entry for Goliad, Texas present in volume 9. The title of the series is taken from the labels on spines, apparently affixed by Sir Thomas Phillipps.

scopecontent.p: 25 ink drawings of views and plans of various areas in Mexico, including Chapultepec Castle, San Luis Potosí, and Goliad, Texas. Accompanied by a letter, apparently signed by Berlandier.

scopecontent.p: Two incomplete portions of a manuscript diary documenting an 1834 journey from Matamoros to Goliad and an 1834 trip from Bexar to the Rio Grande. Includes three maps of rivers, including the Rio de Medina.

did.unittitle: [Berlandier, Jean Louis], compiler
Historia: notes on phases of Mexican history

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes notes on viceroys of Mexico; Mexican revolutions; the revolution of the negroes, 1634; the Inquisition; the Mexican councils; printing in Mexico; and mines. Also includes a table of exports from Mexico, 1826-1828.

did.unittitle: Texas: Statistical and descriptive notes from various sources

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Partial contents include: Villa de Goliad [R. Chovell]; Estadistica de Tejas por el Cd. Almonte, 1834; Censo y Estadistica. Departamento de Bejar, 1832 [Ramon Musquiz]; Censo y estadistica. Departamento de Bejar, 1831 [R. Musquiz]; Rivières du Texas; De l'agriculture des environs de Bejar; Campaña de Texas.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: WA MSS S-319

did.unittitle: [Chovell, Rafael], Journal of scientific observations made in Venezuela

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first 16 pages contain outlines of general research topics under the headings "Des recherches physiques et chimiques sur les eaux," "Autres recherches sur les eaux," "Recherches météorologiques," "Sur l'électricité atmosphérique," "Physique," and "Considérations géologiques." The second part is divided into four sections labelled "Chapitre VII," "Chapitre VIII," "Livre IV," "Chapitre X" and "Chapitre XI," and contains detailed notes on geology, meteorology, natural history, and other scientific observations made while traveling in Venezuela.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On customs administration in Texas; discusses the difficulty of being opposed by the Austin colonists and not supported by Mexican officials.

did.unittitle: Mier y Teran, Manuel de, Letterbook containing letters to General Teran and copies of letters written by him, mainly concerning political affairs in Texas
Austin, Stephen Fuller, Five autograph letters, signed, to Manuel Mier y Teran from Austin, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discussing the Austin Colony's climate, industry, and trade, particularly in cotton and slaves.

did.unittitle: Mier y Teran, Manuel de
Autograph letter to Felipe de la Garza from Matamoros, Mexico

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning affairs in Texas, particularly Mier y Teran's feeling of helpless and lack of aid from customs officers.

did.unittitle: Two autograph letters, signed, to José Batres from Nacogdoches, Texas
Autograph letter to Guadalupe Victoria from Bexar, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning affairs in Texas; includes a description of Texas, its extent, population, local Indians, the Austin Colony, the Mexican population in Texas, and recommendations for action in Texas. Notes that if the Americans are permitted to own slaves, Mexicans should have the same privilege.

did.unittitle: Autograph letter to Vicente Guerrero from Matamoros, Mexico

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning affairs in Texas; advises Guerrero to ask Congress to send 10,000 Mexican families to colonize Texas.

processinfo.p: Former call number: WA MSS S-329

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript diary of Pedro Walker made in accordance with the commands of Joaquin de Arredondo. Walker traveled from Monterey to Laredo, Carrizo, the Nueces River, Bexar, Revilla (where he fought Indians), and Soto la Marina.

did.unittitle: Berlandier, Voyage a les Parties N.O. du Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account of the expedition of the northwest part of Texas. Includes description of the land, its flora and fauna, and an encounter with the Comanche.The party included Berlandier, Rafael Chovell, and Francisco Ruiz.

Calculos de Observaciones Hechas desde el 16 de Oct Hasta el 31 de Dicho, 1832

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Astronomical calculations made by Berlandier and Chovell.

did.unittitle: De San Antonio de Bexar á la Rivera sur del Rio de la Trinidad

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Describes Gonzales, colonial infrastructure, and Autin's colony and its attitude toward slavery. Signed by Rafael Chovell and Luis Berlandier.

did.unittitle: Sketched maps: Bahia de Matagorda; Barra de Aransas; La costa desde Matagorda hasta la boca del Rio Bravo del Norte; Bahia de Galveston; Itinerario de Laredo a Bexar

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Six maps; includes table of distances.

did.unittitle: [Mier y Teran, Manuel de], Nota Medico-Statistique de Matamoros

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ascribed to Teran by Henry R. Wagner.

did.unittitle: Gayoso de Lemos, Manuel, Sixteen autograph letters, signed, to William Dunbar from New Orleans and Natchez, concerning running the United States-Florida boundary line

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description of letters available in the folder. Dates include: 1797 January 10, March 9 (2 letters), April 9, and December 20; 1798 February 4, March 15, March 31, April 14, April 30, May 12, June 26, August 3, August 21, August 31, and December 11.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: WA MSS S-331

did.unittitle: Materials purchased from H. P. Kraus, Inc.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat WA MSS 56

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from H. P. Kraus, Inc. on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 1986.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series II is arranged in the order in which it was originally cataloged by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection contains three journals created by Jean Louis Berlandier detailing trips in Matamoros, Tampico, Tamaulipas, and Nuevo Leon from 1826-1844.

did.unittitle: Berlandier, Journal d'un voyage au Mexique

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript journal in two volumes detailing Berlandier's 1826-1831 trip to Mexico. Berlandier records the details of his journey and meteorological observations, particularly in Matamoros and elsewhere in Tamaulipas.

did.unittitle: Berlandier, Excursion dans le Nouveau Leon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript journal detailing a trip to Nuevo Leon and describing the geography and people of the region.

did.unittitle: Berlandier, Route de Tampico de Tamaulipas a Mexico at sejour dans cette capitale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript journal containing meteorological, geographical, and social observations made on a trip to Tampico, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

did.unittitle: Material donated by William S. Reese

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat WA MS File Berlandier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains one autograph manuscript French-Spanish vocabulary.

did.unittitle: Berlandier, Interpretates Veborum

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript French-Spanish vocabulary.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Berlandier Manuscripts

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat WA MS 178

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Possibly purchased from Henry R. Wagner, 1919.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series IV is arranged in the order in which it was originally cataloged by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection contains assorted manuscripts from Henry R. Wagner concerning metallurgical, astronomical, medical, and historical observations made by Jean Louis Berlandier, Rafael Chovell, and others.

did.unittitle: Cuaderno No.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound manuscript document with four entries by Rafael Chovell concerning metallurgical and astronomical observations.

did.unittitle: Yellow Fever

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript documents pertaining to Yellow Fever in Tamaulipas and New Orleans. Also includes a newspaper clipping on Yellow Fever in New Orleans from an unidentified publication.

did.unittitle: Diseases in Matamoros

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four manuscript documents in Spanish and French on the treatment of Cholera and other diseases.

did.unittitle: Medecine et chirurgie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three manuscript documents concerning health conditions in Matamoros and Tampico.

did.unittitle: Del libro intitulado noticias sairas [?] de las indias occidentes, su author Juan Diez de la Calle edit. 1646, se sacaron estas noticias

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript document summarizing the voyages of Christopher Columbus, the conquest of Mexico by Cortes, and the introduction of Christianity into New Spain.

did.unittitle: Documents relating to natural history

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript copies of three documents in Spanish and French, bound together, pertaining to the establishment by the king of a collection of natural history in Madrid in 1776, the gathering of specimens for this collection, the subject of natural history more broadly, and the origin of the Indians.

did.unittitle: Extracto del descubrimiento del archipielago del Norte que los Russos han dado a Luz en su Calendario Geographico de este año de 1774

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript document concerning the Russian discovery of a northern archipelago and the exploratory activities of other countries in the north.

did.unittitle: Berlandier documents relating to Mexican cities and populations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript documents, eight in French and eight in Spanish, probably relating to Berlandier, with notes on Galeana, Tamaulipas, and Matamoros.

did.unittitle: Documents pertaining to Berlandier

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents in Spanish and French pertaining to Berlandier. Includes several documents relating to medicine and public health; "Poesyas Varias. Sacadas de los mas selectos autores. Para el uso y gusto de Don Jose Vicente Luna"; an autograph letter, signed, to an unidentified "Dear Sir" from J. Erich Bohmann; and typescript fragments of an unidentfied work.
